artist: Artist: Carlos Amorales; Printer: Highpoint Editions, Minneapolis; Publisher: Highpoint Editions, Minneapolis
creditline: Highpoint Editions Archive, The Friends of Bruce B. Dayton Acquisition Fund and the Christina N. and Swan J. Turnblad Memorial Fund
description: A diptych printed from six laser-engraved Plexiglas plates in the shape of four bird heads, a woman's legs, and an ape in red and blue inks. The plates were printed in an overlapping arrangement designed by the artist. One panel of the diptych was printed with the plates inked and wiped intaglio style. The second panel was printed after adding a relief roll of ink in addition to the inked and wiped lines. The intaglio printed lines stand visibly on the relief printed flat.
image_copyright: Copyright © Carlos Amorales%2C published by Highpoint Editions
markings: LLC in pencil on each sheet: ARCHIVE 1/2 | Publisher\'s blindstamp, LLC on each sheet: HP
medium: Color intaglio (panel a); color intaglio and relief (panel b); printed from laser-engraved acrylic templates; diptych
provenance: Highpoint Editions, Minneapolis (publisher); sold to MIA, 2020.
signed: LRC in pencil of L sheet: C. Amorales 2010 | BC in pencil of L sheet: Skeleton Images - Azar Composition Duo
title: Skeleton Images – Azar Compositions Duo
